label: Petition from Ann Charlotte Mackinzie to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Ann Charlotte Mackinzie to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance in returning home to Britain, explaining that she is the daughter of a Regiment Captain but is now unable to support herself.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Ann Charlotte Mackinzie to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance in returning home to Britain, explaining that she is the daughter of a Regiment Captain but is now unable to support herself.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Charleston July 26th 1790

Gentlemen

The Person who now addresses you is daughter to Capt. Alexander Mackinzie of the 84th Regiment. She has resided some time in South Carolina and is by misfortune reduced to such distress as to be unable to support herself. She is therefore desirous of returning to her friends in Britain where on her arrival she is assured of a comfortable asylum; but not having the means to pay her passage or supply herself with necessaries for the voyage, she humbly solicits whatever assistance your humane and Charitable society will be pleased in your goodness to allow her. 

And she will, as in duty bound, ever pray.

Ann Charlotte Mackinzie [signature of applicant]

metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
